alert.note: Alert for Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 1:44PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Warren, northeastern Nash and Halifax Counties through 230 PM EST... At 143 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ebony to 8 miles northwest of Nashville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Littleton, Enfield, Weldon, Glenview, Medoc Mountain State Park, Aventon, Lake Gaston and Southpointe And Morningstar Marinas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued.
